channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Several British flags put up illegally in Bexley Village on 25.09, 26th September
item.description:
Several British Union Jack flags have been put up illegally on our street (lamposts), along North Cray Road, going into Bexley Village. These are unauthorised items and could put motorists / pedestrians at risk. These flags are a symbol of prejudice, not patriotism, and are creating hostility towards not only refugees but also people of colour in our community. This feels very provocative at a time of tensions regarding immigration. Please could these all be taken down? Thank you so much in advance for your consideration and understanding
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley High Street, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yes, in most areas of London, vehicles parked on the pavement constitute an obstruction and a contravention of highway legislation, as it violates the general ban on pavement parking and can cause unnecessary obstruction to pedestrians. Under existing powers, this can result in fines or even a penalty charge notice (PCN) and potential towing, as the Greater London (General Purposes) Act 1974 and other laws prohibit pavement parking to protect pedestrians and the footway. 50% of narrow footpath obstructed by YF72MXY 26/09/25 at 06:15hrs., 26th September
item.description:
Yes, in most areas of London, vehicles parked on the pavement constitute an obstruction and a contravention of highway legislation, as it violates the general ban on pavement parking and can cause unnecessary obstruction to pedestrians. Under existing powers, this can result in fines or even a penalty charge notice (PCN) and potential towing, as the Greater London (General Purposes) Act 1974 and other laws prohibit pavement parking to protect pedestrians and the footway. 50% of narrow footpath obstructed by YF72MXY 26/09/25 at 06:15hrs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Grove, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: English flags and union jacks on public property, 26th September
item.description:
There are English flags and union jacks hung on street lamps and road signs all over Sidcup. Faraday Avenue, Lewis Road, Sidcup Hill, Ruxley roundabout. The one I pinned on the map must have been out up on 25th September between 20:30 and 22:30 based on the information from my doorbell camera. Given the current political situation and the meaning behind these, it makes us very uncomfortable and we would like to request for these to be taken down please. I'd happily do it myself but they are unfortunately too high up for a person to reach without equipment. Please feel free to contact me for more information or with any updates. I have lived in Bexley borough for 10 years and now it feels incredibly unwelcoming.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lewis Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stolen Bike, 26th September
item.description:
Reported this stolen motorbike to the Police on Monday CAD5404 the number plate HT17 EPC is coming up as a red scotter Honder. This is a black motorbike. Its been here all week. It's in a residential parking bay for the flats and its attracting anti social behaviour. We need this parking space back and the Bike removed. Police weren't interested when we reported. Said to contact yourselves to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bournewood Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
